subject: Sleep
title: Hypnic Jerks Explained
description: A fast breakdown of Hypnic Jerks Explained for builders.

hook.text: You're falling asleep and suddenly your whole body jerks violently. You feel like you were falling.

buildup.text: These are hypnic jerks, also called sleep starts. Up to 70 percent of people experience them.

discovery.text: They happen during the N1 transition when muscles relax unevenly and the brain misreads the signals.

twist.text: One theory says the brain interprets sudden muscle relaxation as falling and triggers a protective reflex.

climax.text: Caffeine, stress, and sleep deprivation all increase their frequency. They're harmless but startling.

punchline.text: Your brain thinks you're falling. Your bed disagrees.

quiz.question: When do hypnic jerks typically occur?
options: During the N1 transition into sleep
